                    Editorial Reviews
 Leaping back into action, gun-slinging, guitar-toting hero "El Mariachi" is back in town in  Once Upon a Time in Mexico , as director Robert Rodriguez delivers the epic final chapter of his pulp Western trilogy. Starring Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Johnny Depp, Mickey Rourke, Eva Mendes, Enrique Iglesias and Willem Dafoe  Once Upon a Time in Mexico  is a full-frontal assault.
 Special features 
 Deleted Scenes with Optional Commentary  Ten-Minute Flick School  Inside Troublemaker Studios  Ten-Minute COOKING School  Film is Dead: An Evening with Robert Rodriguez  The Anti-Hero's Journey  The Good, the Bad and the Bloody: Inside KNB FX  Robert Rodriguez Audio Commentary  MovieIQ  The Cutting Room

Please try again later. 5.0 out of 5 stars A Masterpiece in every way shape and form. By Mark L. Rakocy on September 11, 2017 Format: Amazon Video | Verified Purchase A knock your socks off movie worth owning and reflecting upon.I especially like how the "Johnny Depp" Character was hidden in plain sight throughout the film. I.E.....he is a C.I.A. operator in Mexico wearing a C.I.A.-shirt, as well as a few other things he does. Read more 0 Comment | Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Report abuse 5.0 out of 5 stars Five Stars By Anna Bates on March 17, 2017 Format: DVD | Verified Purchase Great present Read more 0 Comment | 
      One person found this helpful.
  Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Report abuse 4.0 out of 5 stars Great movie but soundtrack lacking By Stephanie Donald on February 6, 2013 Format: MP3 Music | Verified Purchase This is perhaps the crown jewel in Robert Rodriguez's "garage studio" productions and while the script of the movie and the acting staff is wonderful, the majority of the soundtrack is where you see how he cut money. Most of the tracks were things he wrote in his garage and the wonderful, rich sound he accomplished that enriched the drama, comedy and romance of "Desperado" is so obviously missing from this movie with the exception of just a few places and while I say that Robert Rodriguez's own themes aren't bad, they simply don't compare with Dire Straits, Los Lobos, Tito & Tarantula and Link Wray so prominently featured in the Desperado soundtrack. But that doesn't mean it still isn't worth owning. The music still causes me to remember key parts of the movie such as Johnny Depp playing "fast draw" with two of Marguez's men with no eyes and using his ears alone. Not a bad trick for someone who was born blind let alone someone who just lost his sight! It's what I cal an above average soundtrack but not one you should stampede to buy like Desperado! Read more 0 Comment | Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Report abuse 4.0 out of 5 stars ... Banderas and Johnny Depp are young and obviously had fun making this movie By Larry on August 11, 2017 Format: Amazon Video | Verified Purchase Antonio Banderas and Johnny Depp are young and obviously had fun making this movie. My son and I made the dish that Johnny Depp eats at the cafe and had it for movie night. It was a great recipe! Read more 0 Comment | Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Report abuse 5.0 out of 5 stars Once Upon a Time in Mexico By Nathan Shepherd Enthusiast: Batman on August 10, 2009 Format: DVD | Verified Purchase I choose this rating because the movie is good. What I like about the movie is that leaping back into action, gun-slinging, guitar-toting hero “El Mariachi” is back in town in Once Upon A Time In Mexico, as director Robert Rodriguez delivers the epic final chapter of his pulp Western trilogy. Starring Antonio Banderas, Salma Hayek, Johnny Depp, Mickey Rourke, Eva Mendes, Enrique Iglesias and Willem Dafoe Once Upon A Time In Mexico is a full-frontal assault. What I dislike about the movie is that I wanted to see more of it. I would recommend this movie to other people. Read more 0 Comment | Was this review helpful to you? Yes No Report abuse 5.0 out of 5 stars Great movie, entertaining with a great cast By rural.life.tn on September 16, 2017 Format: DVD | Verified Purchase Great movie that has a great cast of so many great actors/actresses.
